net.asrex.skillful.skill

Class SkillRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.asrex.skillful.skill.SkillRegistry

  • public class SkillRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    A central registry for all Skill classes. Other mods may register skill packs here with registerPack(String, Class).

      • registerSkillDefinition

        public static void registerSkillDefinition(SkillDefinition def)
        Registers the given SkillDefinition. A new instance of the skill will be added to player data (generally) on next player login, or when the skill is first seeded.

        Note that except in special cases, mods should generally not define their own skills. Ideally, they should allow players to configure skills as they see fit, and can optionally create SkillPack classes to aid in this process.

        Parameters:
        def - the skill definition to register

      • getSkillDefinitions

        public static java.util.Collection<SkillDefinition> getSkillDefinitions()
        Gets a list of all currently registered skill classes.
        Returns:
        the list of registered skill classes

      • getDefinition

        public static SkillDefinition getDefinition(java.lang.String name)

      • registerPack

        public static void registerPack(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.Class<? extends SkillPack> packClass)
        Registers a skill pack provider with the given name. Names should be all lower-case and consist only of letters a-z and underscores ('_').

        Skill packs are used in the skill configuration to allow users to add preconfigured collections of skills in bulk. For additional information and requirements for skill pack implementations, see SkillPack. Note that names will implicitly be prefixed with '!' character in configuration file.

        Third-party skill packs should be registered at startup during the FMLInitializationEvent. Skill configuration will be read from disk during the FMLPostInitializationEvent, and any missing definitions at this time will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        name - the name for the configuration tag to associate with the given class
        packClass - the class of the skill pack to register

      • getPacks

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends SkillPack>> getPacks()

      • registerScalingStrategy

        public static void registerScalingStrategy(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Class<? extends ScalingStrategy> clazz)
        Registers a level scaling strategy implementation with the given name. Names should be all lower-case and consist only of letters a-z and underscores ('_').

        Scaling strategies are used to determine the amount of experience points for skills needed to progress in a given level. They are specified by players as part of the configured SkillDefinition.

        Third-party scaling strategies should be registered at startup during the FMLInitializationEvent. Skill configuration will be read from disk during the FMLPostInitializationEvent, and any missing definitions at this time will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the scaling strategy to add, for use in the configuration file
        clazz - the class of the implementation to add

      • registerRequirement

        public static void registerRequirement(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.Class<? extends Requirement> requirementType)
        Registers a skill requirement provider. Names should be all lower-case and consist only of letters a-z and underscores ('_').

        Requirements are used in the skills configuration to create instances of their associated Requirement object. Note that they will implicitly be prefixed with '!' in configuration file.

        Third-party requirements should be registered at startup during the FMLInitializationEvent. Skill configuration will be read from disk during the FMLPostInitializationEvent, and any missing definitions will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        name - the name for the configuration tag to associate with the given class
        requirementType - the class to associate with the given tag name
